poem:
Title: "Through Myra's Reed"

In Jasmine's brass, a whisper unfolds,
Uncoiling sonnets of the soul,
With subtle breaths and snapping beats,
Her alto story subtly repeats.
From harmonic loom, her fingers strive,
To bring the silent aether alive.
Myra, lean into your tune,
Strike the resonance of the moon.
Her soft insistence pierces the night,
A horizon bound to its yielding light.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jasmine Myra: Rising review – gently insistent jazz With the release of her 2022 debut album, Horizons, saxophonist Jasmine Myra became a breakout star of the UK jazz scene. Weaving soft and subtle alto saxophone lines through compositions that paired luscious harmonies with snapping rhythms, Myra showcased her skill as a composer rather than an instrumental virtuoso. On her second album, she continues to produce this gently insistent sound, now leaning further into her capabilities". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Jasmine Myra: Rising review – gently insistent jazz With the release of her 2022 debut album, Horizons, saxophonist Jasmine Myra became a breakout star of the UK jazz scene. Weaving soft and subtle alto saxophone lines through compositions that paired luscious harmonies with snapping rhythms, Myra showcased her skill as a composer rather than an instrumental virtuoso. On her second album, she continues to produce this gently insistent sound, now leaning further into her capabilities
